channel.title: Bug/Glitch or something else?
channel.description:
Alright. First, let me make something clear. I will be stating the name of my server and the ip through this post. I do not intend it to be advertising or such. This is for an all problem resolving purpose.
okay, here's the problem. I have recently made my private server online. Took me a few weeks to code a bit and make it player-friendly. then I decided to make it non-hamachi. Took me about a day to do so. After i went through the -complicated (for me)- process of portforwarding, I have tried to post my server on [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?]http://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?[/url] because I figured it would be the best place to attract more people to my server than myself.
After I made a pretty nice post (which took me about half an hour), I clicked on "register server". It gave me an error: "Your server must be online before posting it in here!". So, I double.. No. Triple checked, and it was truly online. Here's what I also made sure of: the input of server IP was really pluc-scape.no-ip.org without any misspelling or such. Then since it still did not work, I tried it on ANOTHER no-ip; ipluc1.no-ip.org . Still didn't work.
After what just happened I thought to myself I could just not give up after all that work. So, I tried bypassing that part and entered instead of 'ip' things like "google.com" and etc. because i truly was convinced it would work anyway.
So now I am left out with an online working server that moparscape recognizes as offline and nobody to help me get it advertised.
What I would just like to know is: Why did it tell me it was offline when it was not? Is it some kind of bug/glitch more people are getting through as we speak?
Thanks for understanding the meaning of the post anyhow,
-Pluc

item.title: Bug/Glitch or something else?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

I would double check to make sure the port is opened. If it is, you should go ahead and post your problem in this topic. As Vain stated, this section is for server programming, not things like opening ports, buying VPS’s, etc.

You can use a website such as http://www.canyouseeme.org to see if a port is opened.

Read full topic

item.title: Bug/Glitch or something else?
item.dc:creator: @PlucScape PlucScape
item.description:
@PlucScape wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]I’m pretty sure it could be merged with the other topic/moved into another section, but that would most likely cause spam.

I will report this topi for now, and we will see whether a moderator locks, or deletes this topic, as it’s their decision.

Anyway, I suggest posting in this topic. Though, you should read a couple pages first, as your question will most likely have been answered.[/quote]

No problem for reporting as long as the thread will have existed.

Here’s one thing - MoparIsTheBest was unfortunately really unclear about the problem I had. It (his thread) somewhat answered my question. It gave me no idea when I should be posting my server and how (since the 30 minute checks).

Hopefully, this will just end as an old thread that have been answered and nothing more-
I don’t see why it should be deleted. 'Should take it as an example for the future experience of other posters//
Should be moved.
But thanks again, anyways.

Read full topic

item.title: Bug/Glitch or something else?
item.dc:creator: @PlucScape PlucScape
item.description:
@PlucScape wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=PlucScape link=topic=480817.msg3520504#msg3520504 date=1299367493]
I did read the rules already.
To the best of my knowledge, I didn’t break any.

P.S. Here’s a tip:
Instead of telling me to read them again, point out my error. That’s what a GM should do.
(I use gm because you seem to be posting “that’s against the rules” on some posts recently)

Thanks.

Edit:
If you took this post as offensive please change your thought; I didn’t want to sound rude or anything. So for that I apologies. I’m just trying to disclaim my post.
[/quote]This section is for help on the sever’s programming errors. Such as errors in content, or other things along that line.

To my best knowledge, this type of thing would be best in the Server Status Page Comments thread, or at least General Questions.

Also, I’m not a moderator, nor will I ever be one, so I don’t have to post like one to tell you this is the wrong section. Sorry.[/quote]

Thank you. So could you guarantee I could repost this in that section without being banned or such for ‘double posting’?

Maybe shall I ask for this thread to be closed first…

Read full topic
